p0.0: Golf Technologies constantly strive to bring you the latest innovations in golf technology, keeping you ahead of the competition. We have all witnessed the change technology has brought to our everyday lives, we are fortunate to bring these advancements to the golfer. The end result being that you learn better and quicker.

Waitakere golf course is in a peaceful and picturesque setting amongst the Waitakere Rangers, where you can enjoy the sights and sounds of nature just 30-minutes form Auckland’s city centre. The golf course offers a unique layout where each hole has its own characteristics and can challenge golfers of all levels.

Intro.content:
The Junior Golf Academy is a structured and goal-oriented program, with a key focus on students’ long-term enjoyment and success.

Students are supported through a critical time in both their physical development and golf development.

The students will progressively learn all aspects of the golf game as they go through the 5-level development system.

With this in-depth combination of teaching skills, physical and mental coaching, our students will have all the tools to succeed.


The students will be evaluated on the following:
• 	Golf swing technical skills
• 	Statistical performance
• 	Physical movement proficiency
• 	Social and mental development
• 	Understanding equipment
• 	On course knowledge

p0.0: The Junior Golf Academy is a structured and goal-oriented program, with a key focus on students’ long-term enjoyment and success.
p0.1: Students are supported through a critical time in both their physical development and golf development.
p0.2: The students will progressively learn all aspects of the golf game as they go through the 5-level development system.
p0.3: With this in-depth combination of teaching skills, physical and mental coaching, our students will have all the tools to succeed.

p1.0: The students will be evaluated on the following:

Levels.p0: The program is made up of 5 levels where each level is built upon the previous one.

0.p0: At the beginning, we focus on setting the student up for success by putting all the fundamental learning blocks in place. This includes education around golf swing technique, golf equipment, and on course knowledge.

1.p0: Building on a strong foundation, students will learn key check points in the swing, and will be gradually introduced to a more detailed skill set in all areas of the game.

2.p0: At this level there is a shift to developing students for all on-course situations. Skill development continues; however, it becomes more detailed focused.

3.p0: The advanced level sees students working more on statistical outcomes. The focus is on reinforcing personal swing form, along with additional specialty skills.

4.p0:
The high-performance level is outcome driven, with a significant commitment required to pursue a specific goal,
 such as a golf scholarship, representative golf, or a professional career in golf.

answer.0: The factors we consider when selecting a group are your age, social development, skill level and the time/day preference of the parents.

1.question: What golf equipment is required for the program?

answer.0: At enrollment you will be given a required equipment list for the level of your development. We place an importance on having the correctly fitted equipment as it can impact significantly on swing development. We are happy to assist with having you correctly fitted for your equipment.

2.question: Different schools have different term dates, what are dates of the program?

answer.0: We set the program dates 6 weeks before the term begins to give parents time to organize their child’s schedule.

3.question: Will class continue if it rains?

answer.0: If we believe class is unable to proceed outside, adjustments will be made to learn indoors. The decision will be made on the morning of class.

4.question: How will I know the location of each class?

answer.0: The locations for each class will be set before the term begins. A schedule be available on the student’s personal portal.

5.question: How many learning modules am I required to complete?

answer.0: The number of modules and content of the modules will be dependent on your level of development. Each module takes approximately 30 minutes to I hour to complete.

6.question: Can my child play at Waitakere golf course outside of class time?

answer.0: Yes. All students will be a full member of Waitakere Golf Club and we encourage them to practice and play as much as possible. Please note that a booking is required to play on the golf course.

7.question: If I miss a lesson can it be caught up?

answer.0: Unfortunately, not. However, if there is a place in a class at a time suitable, you will be welcome to participate.

8.question: Will I have access to my learning information if I leave the program?

answer.0: Absolutely! We understand that you will leave us at some point for a variety of different reasons. We would like you to continue your development, and this is best achieved by your next teacher having a detailed profile of your development history.

QA.link: Can’t find the answer to your questions? Please contact us.

0.question: Is the video swing analysis available in Chinese?

answer.0: Yes. Our video analysis lesson includes a voice-over, which can be delivered in either English or Chinese.

1.question: Are the online learning modules available in Chinese?

answer.0: The online learning modules are delivered in your choice of either English or Chinese.

2.question: Who will attend the first consultation?

answer.0: Rhys Ogden will attend the first consultation meeting. A Chinese translator (if applicable) will be present on request for you or your parents ease of communication.

3.question: If I have any questions through the program, is someone available to communicate in Chinese?

answer.0: Yes. We understand the importance of communication, either from our students or parents on behalf of our students. A Chinese speaking contact person will be available throughout the program.

0.question: Is the video swing analysis available in Korean?

answer.0: Yes. Our video analysis lesson includes a voice-over, which can be delivered in either English or Korean.

1.question: Are the online learning modules available in Korean?

answer.0: The online learning modules are delivered in your choice of either English or Korean.

2.question: Who will attend the first consultation?

answer.0: Rhys Ogden will attend the first consultation meeting. A Korean translator (if applicable) will be present on request for you or your parents ease of communication.

3.question: If I have any questions through the program, is someone available to communicate in Korean?

answer.0: Yes. We understand the importance of communication, either from our students or parents on behalf of our students. A Korean speaking contact person will be available throughout the program.

p0.0: The Membership Program is a three-level golf development program where each level is built upon the previous one.
p0.1: Throughout the program students will progressively develop their knowledge in all areas of the game, including understanding golf equipment, golf course knowledge and all areas of swing technique.
p0.2: The program is structured in a way where students have the resources to learn remotely, or options are available for those who wish to add practical tuition to support their learnings.

p0.0: Step one is to set the student up to get the most out of the program.
p0.1: Rhys will meet the student ideally in person, or by Zoom if the student is Learning remotely.

p1.2: Connect the student to the Coach now app
p1.3: Review how to work through the program

Intro.content:
The Remote Learning Program is a new addition to the BP Golf Academy services. It is a project that is still under construction with availability dates set out in the membership details below. 

The dates listed allow us the time deliver the Remote Learning Program service to the high standard we want for our students.

In order to maximise your learning opportunity we have created a comprehensive self-learning program. This provides you with the flexibility to learn at your own pace whilst working around other commitments.

You will receive a comprehensive toolkit of services, designed to ensure you are fully supported and continually learning the skills required to perfect your technique and knowledge.

The program is aligned with our online modular learning system, which includes topic information, video instruction and interactive quizzes to reinforce learning.

p0.0: Prior to the program commencement, we will arrange to meet, preferably in person, or alternatively online. This is a chance to discuss your goals and expected outcomes for the course.
p0.1: We will also take the opportunity to set up the program and teach you how to optimize your learning experience to ensure you get the most from the program.
p0.2: A practical session is also an option (location dependent) to evaluate your current skill level. If this option is not possible , swing video can be forwarded and review by your coach
p0.3: We look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to our program!

p0.0: There are 70 comprehensive online learning modules.
All program information in a clear easy-to-follow format. Modules contains detailed information, demonstration videos, and interactive quizzes.
Regardless of your level, the modules are formatted to deliver the relevant course information.
Topics covered in the Remote Learning Program include Golf Equipment, The Golf Course, Building your Golf Swing and Building your Short Game.
Receive a 10% discount on your next program when you achieve your required marks.
For easy communication for students or parents, we have a person to communicate in English, Korean and Chinese when arranging the program.
The module program and the golf swing video analysis is available by in-person instruction from Rhys Ogden. (Location dependent. Extra fees apply)
For those of you wishing to improve your English, this is a great opportunity to do that while improving your golf game!

price.title: Program Availability
price.description:
Building your Short Game 				 03/06/2022 

Golf Equipment / The Golf Course 		 03/09/2022 

Building your Golf Swing 				 03/12/2022

0.question: Is the remote learning program suitable for a beginner golfer?

answer.0: The program is best suited for a beginner as it can be followed in a methodical and structured way that leads to efficient learning. The program is based around the right information at the right time.

1.question: What golf equipment do I need for the program?

answer.0: At enrollment you will be advised of the equipment required specific to your program. At the first consultation an appraisal of your current equipment will be undertaken. Having the correctly fitted equipment is essential for your development. It is one of the reasons that equipment is a major topic of the program.

2.question: How do I send a swing video to the coach?

answer.0: It is a very easy process done through the Coach Now app. A Step-by-step demonstration will be shown at the first consultation.

3.question: How often can I send a question to the instructor through the Coach Now app?

answer.0: The instructors are always available and welcome questions as your development is important to them. However, we do ask that you respect the fact that there are many students under the coach’s guidance.

4.question: Will I have access to my learning information if I leave the program?

answer.0: Absolutely! We understand that you will leave us at some point for a variety of different reasons. We would like you to continue your development, and this is best achieved by your next teacher having a detailed profile of your development history.

0.title: Class Length
0.description: The Junior Academy Program runs throughout school terms. Please contact us for a comprehensive program timetable.

1.title: Class Duration
1.description: Class duration is one hour; however, we require the students to be there 15 minutes early to go through a warmup. This ensures we make the most of our class time.

2.title: Class Timetable
2.description: We aim to have class times throughout the weekend and on weekends. The timetable will be set 2 months before term begins.

3.title: Class Numbers
3.description: To make sure we get enough time for each student we limit the class numbers to 6 students per class.

4.title: Course Location
4.description: We have two locations: Waitakere Golf Course. A quiet location where students develop on-course skills in a stress-free environment. Rutherford College, a spacious environment where we can setup creative learning stations.

5.title: Assessment Day
5.description: We conduct an assessment day prior to program commencement to ensure the students are at the correct level to get the most from the program.

6.title: BP Student Login
6.description: Students will be provided with a login to a portal on the BP Golf Academy website, containing their personal progress information. This is only accessible to the student and their coach.

7.title: Online learning
7.description: Students will have access to online learning modules covering golf equipment, golf course knowledge and swing technique. The modules include topic information, video instruction and interactive quizzes to reinforce learning. (30 minutes per module)

8.title: Equipment
8.description: Students will have access to the Coach Now app for easy communication with instructors, sending video analysis and Q&A.

9.title: Development Plans
9.description: Each student will be given weekly practice tasks with options to complete either at home or at a practice facility.

10.title: Athlete Development
10.description: Based at AUT Millennium, Athlete Development will provide out Junior Academy students with training and education to better their physical and mental development skills.

11.title: Rewards
11.description: Upon reaching achievement goals, students are incentivized by receiving a 10% discount on the next program.

12.title: Student Pack
12.description: At the commencement of the program, each student will receive a gift pack.

13.title: Golf Course Membership
13.description: At enrolment students will receive a one-year Junior membership at Waitakere Golf Club.

15.title: Class Duration
15.description: We offer flexibility for students to work around other commitments, with 6 months to complete the course from the beginning of the program.

16.title: Student Portal
16.description: Students will be provided with a login to a portal on the BP Golf Academy website, containing their personal progress information. This is only accessible to the student and their instructor.

17.title: Online Learning Modules
17.description:
Module contains detailed information, videos, and interactive quizzes. The modules are structured in a systematic way to encourage students to develop the necessary knowledge and skills at the relevant learning point.
The parameters of the online learning program are set at 6 months, to ensure you keep your learning structure, while still learning flexibly at your own pace.

18.title: Video Swing Analysis
18.description:
Students will receive 12 video swing analysis lessons. The videos include detailed analysis and voice-over instruction.
Note: Video swing analysis is not part of the Golf Equipment program and The Golf Course program.

19.title: Lessons Plan
19.description: Specific to each student, a practice plan will be created that reflects the information from the learning modules and personal swing analysis.

20.title: Coach Now App
20.description: Students will have access to the Coach Now app for easy communication with instructors, sending video analysis and Q&A.

21.title: Member Discount
21.description: Academy members will receive a discount on additional coaching services from Rhys Ogden and the Performance Instructors.

Intro.content:
Our screening process is in place to get a detailed account of the students current level. It underpins the development plan by setting a benchmark from which goals and development comparisons can be made.

The more information the coach has about the student, the better the development plan and learning efficiency.
Intro.noteDiscard: Screening service will be available in South Korea from May 1st 2022

Swing.description: We use the latest in golf swing analysis technology to get a detailed understanding of each golfer’s swing form. Specifically, the data will help to identify specific areas where changes can be made to produce the desired ball flight.

points.1: Understand how to create the desired ball flight.
points.2: The distance the ball travels for each club.

Swing.summary: At the conclusion of the screening a report will be available that includes all data collected. The report will also contain recommended areas of development.

Club.description:
To maximise correct swing technique, it is important to have correctly fitted equipment. 

Throughout the process we gather information so we can fit equipment to your specific game and the common environments that you participate.

State of the art analysis technology will be used in the process to analyze the most specific dynamics of the golf club and shot results.

points.2: Recommendations for current equipment alterations, or new equipment options.

Club.summary: A detailed equipment specification report will be available to you. This is a great reference to have for the consistency of future fitting sessions.

Movement.description:
AUT Millennium Sports Performance Clinic will provide the services for physical screening and development programs.

Movement screening is based around the body and swing connection. The movement screening will allow the golf coach to identify the most efficient way for you to swing according to your body functionality.

The screening options begin with balance and movement competency, with further options for advanced athletes, assessing dynamic strength, body composition and nutrition.

points.0: Identify areas where injury may occur.
points.1: Identify areas of limitations for development.

Movement.summary: At the conclusion of the screening a report will be available that identifies areas with limitations, along with a movement development plan.

0.question: Golf analysis technology looks too confusing to me. Do I need all this data?

answer.0: The golf analysis technology produces a large and detailed amount of data. This data is more for the coach than the student. Our coaches will only relay the data that will benefit your development. Our personal view is to gain as much information as possible and keep it as simple as possible for you.

1.question: Do I need to know all the data terminology?

answer.0: This is not a requirement as the coach will educate you on the terms specific to your development. However, learning and understanding the data terms and meanings can only increase your comfort with technology and understanding swing technique.

2.question: Is club fitting suitable for beginner golfers?

answer.0: Yes. There are essential elements of the golf club that must suit the individual to allow for correct swing motion, and that applies to golfers of all levels. It is also important to note that the purpose of the fitting session between a beginner and advanced golfer is quite different.

3.question: Can my current clubs be fitted for me?

answer.0: Yes. Adjustments can be made by way of reshafting, regripping and lie / loft adjustments.

4.question: Why is it important for the coach to know how I move?

answer.0: It will inform the coach of your physical areas of limitation, and will help to determine the method applied to develop your swing. If the movement limitations are unable to be developed, the coach will create a swing form around those limitations.

QA.link: Can’t find the answer to your questions? Please contact us.

Intro.content:
Our instruction is structure based.

Beginning by establishing a solid foundation, you will develop your game in a highly organized way.

Using evidence-based principles, we formulate a swing specific to your individual movement patterns and game preference.

From within your skill set, we encourage creativity and shot making while still maintaining core swing principles. 

We place a priority on understanding individual learning styles and adapting the knowledge and learning process to each student. 

Ultimately the goal of our instruction is for you to develop your golf game in the most efficient way possible.

TBA.name: TBA
TBA.description: The Performance Instructors provide an exclusive service to our BP Golf Academy members. Our Performance Instructors are in the process of completing their Masters in Human Movement and Sport Psychology, so they will bring a unique perspective to the learning process, and add a further level of understanding.

0.question: Where is the location of the lesson?

answer.0: Waitakere Golf Course, Auckland.

1.question: How do I qualify for a member price?

answer.0:
You must be one of the following :
- Remote Learning Program Member
- Junior Academy member
- Waitakere Golf Course member
- Rutherford College students or staff

2.question: What is the price for 2 or more students per lesson?

answer.0: For each additional student, add 20% to the price stated.

3.question: What is the price for a non-member learning with a member?

answer.0:
We view you as a guest of the member so you will be charged at the members rate.
In order to qualify for members pricing, at least one student per group is required to be a member.

4.question: Do the lesson packages have an expiry date?

answer.0: Yes. One year from the purchase date.
Yes, we can provide a nicely presented lesson voucher in either a digital format or in hardcopy.

QA.link: Can‘t find the answer to your questions? Please contact us.

Rhys.name: RHYS OGDEN
Rhys.description:
Rhys will periodically be in South Korea. During that period, if you wish to meet Rhys in person to discuss any learning opportunities, you are welcome to contact him directly or alternatively contact our Korean information service to make an appointment.

Schedule details yet to be determined. Dates will be displayed on the BP Golf Academy Website.

points.0: Familiarise yourself with parts of the golf club and their importance.
points.1: Find out which equipment is required for specific skill levels.
points.2: Learn how equipment can impact your performance.
points.3: Understand the relationship between equipment and golf course conditions.
points.4: Learn how equipment can impact your swing technique.
points.5: Understand the importance of golf club fitting.
points.6: Be knowledgeable and confident when purchasing equipment and know how to ask the right questions.

points.1: Understand how to participate in a social setting on the golf course, including rules and etiquette.
points.2: Lean how to score, including the various types of golf games.
points.5: Get the most out of your score through strategy and shot selection.

outcome.h1: Chipping / Pitching / Wedge Game / Bunker Shots / Putting

points.0: Execute swing technique for the specific shot types.
points.1: Understand where to play the various shot types.
points.3: Selecting the correct shot type to play.
points.5: Adjust technique for specialty shots, including lies and slopes.

points.0: Swing Setup – Create a strong swing foundation.
points.1: Motion – Understand how each body part moves throughout the swing.
points.2: Key Swing Position – Execute key swing positions.
points.3: Swing Sequence – Develop a dynamic swing motion.
points.4: Golf Club Dynamics – Understand how the golf club moves through impact including key data.
points.5: Specialty Shots – Make swing adjustments to play slopes/lies/shot shaping.

description.0: A PGA golf professional for 23 years, Rhys Ogden is the founder of BP Golf Academy and the Head of Instruction.
description.1: After completing his PGA traineeship at Mt Maunganui Golf Club, he taught high performance junior golfers in South Korea. This strengthened his coaching ability by immersing himself in another culture, with different learning styles, communication, and key outcomes.
description.2: Over the next 12 years, he would hold the positions of Head Golf Professional, lecturer, and Golf Paper Leader at Auckland University of Technology (AUT).
description.3: During his time at AUT, Rhys developed and delivered the golf curriculum for the University. He was fortunate enough to have learnt from many leading sporting coaches and specialists, and this combined knowledge and experience has helped to shape the curriculum that BP Golf Academy delivers today.
